item.title: [HIVE-6697] HiveServer2 secure thrift/http authentication needs to support SPNego
item.description:
Looking to integrating Apache Knox to work with HiveServer2 secure thrift/http.

Found that thrift/http uses some form of Kerberos authentication that is not SPNego. Considering it is going over http protocol, expected it to use SPNego protocol.

Apache Knox is already integrated with WebHDFS, WebHCat, Oozie and HBase Stargate using SPNego for authentication.

Requesting that HiveServer2 secure thrift/http authentication support SPNego.
item.summary: HiveServer2 secure thrift/http authentication needs to support SPNego

item.title: [HIVE-6698] hcat.py script does not correctly load the hbase storage handler jars
item.description:
Currently queries using the HBaseHCatStorageHandler when run using hcat.py fail. Example query

create table pig_hbase_1(key string, age string, gpa string)
STORED BY 'org.apache.hcatalog.hbase.HBaseHCatStorageHandler'
TBLPROPERTIES ('hbase.columns.mapping'=':key,info:age,info:gpa');

Following error is seen in the hcat logs:

2014-03-18 08:25:49,437 ERROR ql.Driver (SessionState.java:printError(541)) - FAILED: SemanticException java.io.IOException: Error in loading storage handler.org.apache.hcatalog.hbase.HBaseHCatStorageHandler
org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.parse.SemanticException: java.io.IOException: Error in loading storage handler.org.apache.hcatalog.hbase.HBaseHCatStorageHandler

	at org.apache.hive.hcatalog.cli.SemanticAnalysis.HCatSemanticAnalyzer.postAnalyze(HCatSemanticAnalyzer.java:242)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.Driver.compile(Driver.java:402)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.Driver.compile(Driver.java:295)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.Driver.compileInternal(Driver.java:949)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.Driver.runInternal(Driver.java:997)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.Driver.run(Driver.java:885)
	at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.Driver.run(Driver.java:875)
	at org.apache.hive.hcatalog.cli.HCatDriver.run(HCatDriver.java:43)
	at org.apache.hive.hcatalog.cli.HCatCli.processCmd(HCatCli.java:259)
	at org.apache.hive.hcatalog.cli.HCatCli.processLine(HCatCli.java:213)
	at org.apache.hive.hcatalog.cli.HCatCli.main(HCatCli.java:172)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at org.apache.hadoop.util.RunJar.main(RunJar.java:212)
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Error in loading storage handler.org.apache.hcatalog.hbase.HBaseHCatStorageHandler
	at org.apache.hive.hcatalog.common.HCatUtil.getStorageHandler(HCatUtil.java:432)
	at org.apache.hive.hcatalog.cli.SemanticAnalysis.CreateTableHook.postAnalyze(CreateTableHook.java:199)
	... 16 more
Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.apache.hcatalog.hbase.HBaseHCatStorageHandler

item.title: [HIVE-6699] Fix OrcRecordUpdater to use sync instead of flush
item.description: OrcRecordUpdater needs to use sync so that changes are visible before the client closes the file.
item.summary: Fix OrcRecordUpdater to use sync instead of flush

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Makes the obvious change.
Ok, the fix is a little more complicated. Hadoop 1.x needs sync and Hadoop 2.x need hflush, so I added a shim for hflush and make it use sync in Hadoop 1.x.
I rolled this fix into the final version of the HIVE-6060 patch.

item.title: [HIVE-6705] hive jdbc can not used by jmeter, because of unsupported auto commit feature
item.description:
In apache jmeter ,the autocommit property is required.
but in the hive jdbc the auto commit is unsupported method.

in
/jdbc/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/jdbc/HiveConnection.java

public void setAutoCommit(boolean autoCommit) throws SQLException {
// TODO Auto-generated method stub

throw new SQLException("Method not supported");
}

so ,should we make a mock to support the auto commit property == false ?

public void setAutoCommit(boolean autoCommit) throws SQLException {
// TODO Auto-generated method stub
if(autoCommit)
throw new SQLException("Method not supported");
else
return;
}
item.summary: hive jdbc can not used by jmeter, because of unsupported auto commit feature

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I'm not sure what "mock" means here. HS1's behavior is autoCommit w/o rollback. If Hive allows autoCommit off, then client is responsible to manage transactions, for which hives provides no gears either. Commit() and rollback() will both throw "unsupported" exception also.
I was doubting if the suggested change help JMeter. If so, I guess it's okay to have the change, as it's what HS2 JDBC driver does anyway.
The changes make JMeter to works well.

Misstype.
The changes make JMeter to work well.

I agree with this change. I think it's more preferable to do nothing instead of throwing SQLException("Method not supported").
I have the same problem with Pentaho BI tool (auto-commit).

ATTACHMENT ID: 12669000

I don't think the behavior of this patch is right. Since hive does not yet support manual transactions, all statements autocommit. So, the behavior of isAutoCommit is correct, and setAutoCommit should silently allow autoCommit = true but throw an exception saying the operation is not support if if autocommit = false.

So the patch should look like
```
if (!autoCommit) {
throw new SQLException("disabling autocommit is not supported");
}
```
That is, the behavior of getAutoCommit (returns true) is correct.
That is, the behavior of getAutoCommit (returns true) is correct.
See HIVE-6712 for a patch with this change
HiveConnection.setAutoCommit(boolean) is already implemented in the master branch.

item.title: [HIVE-6706] Tez queries fail when there are no input paths
item.description: Need to disable check for empty input paths in the InputFormat in Tez. Tez allows "empty" vertices to make it easier to handle empty tables, partitions, buckets, etc.
item.summary: Tez queries fail when there are no input paths

item.title: [HIVE-6707] Lazy maps are broken (LazyMap and LazyBinaryMap)
item.description:
LazyPrimitive and LazyBinaryPrimitive overrides hashcode method in HIVE-949. But it failed to override equals() method. As a result, LazyMap and LazyBinaryMap will end up having multiple values for the same key. Both LazyMap and LazyBinaryMap uses LinkedHashMap, so the expected behaviour is to have a single value per unique key.

In the following code from LazyMap (LazyBinaryMap also has same code segment)

LazyPrimitive<?, ?> lazyKey = uncheckedGetKey(i);
if (lazyKey == null) {
  continue;
}
Object key = lazyKey.getObject();
if (key != null && !cachedMap.containsKey(key)) {

lazyKey.hashcode() returns the writable object's hashcode. The containsKeys() method of hash map (http://grepcode.com/file/repository.grepcode.com/java/root/jdk/openjdk/6-b14/java/util/HashMap.java#366) checks if the hashcode are same, if so then it uses equals() method to verify if the key already exists. Since LazyPrimitive does not override equals() method it falls back to use Object equals(). Object equals() will return true only if both object are exactly the same (this == obj).
So in the above code segment, even if the key already exists, the new value will be inserted with hash collision resulting in more number of map entries.
item.summary: Lazy maps are broken (LazyMap and LazyBinaryMap)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: getMapSize() api is broken as well. It does not reported the number of distinct keys. I will fix that as well and will upload a new patch.
Making it patch available for precommit tests.

item.title: [HIVE-6709] HiveServer2 help command is not recognizing properly.
item.description:
Install the HiveServer,
Then Execute the following command for help in Hive_home

./hive --service hiveserver2 --help

Starting HiveServer2
Unrecognized option: -h
usage: hiveserver2
 -H,--help                        Print help information
    --hiveconf <property=value>   Use value for given property

need to provide in -H instead of -h in hiverserver2.sh file

hiveserver2_help() {
  hiveserver2 -H
}
item.summary: HiveServer2 help command is not recognizing properly.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Yea I see it now too, good catch. +1 (non-binding)

Since this affects versions 0.11 and 0.12, the wiki should mention it.

Should the wiki just say that --help doesn't work in those versions? The usage message isn't documented yet, but it could go in this section:

  • HiveServer2: How to Start

Sreenivasulu can correct me if wrong, but looks like running './hive --service hiveserver2 --help' will print an 'unrecognized option' error, but as a side effect of that error, still displays the usage. In other words, any parse error (even one trying to display usage) displays the usage.

Up to you whether we want to document the defect, as it works in a weird way, but definitely the usage in general is good to document.
Oh, right. But there's only one option besides help (--hiveconf) and that's standard for Hive, so does it really need to be documented in the wiki? Well, no harm putting it in.
Committed to trunk. Thanks, Sreenivasulu!

Added a Usage Message section:

  • Setting Up HiveServer2: How to Start
Thanks Ashutosh Chauhan, szehon and Lefty Leverenz for Review the Patch.

Szehon Ho

 public boolean process(String[] argv) {
    try {
      commandLine = new GnuParser().parse(options, argv);
      if (commandLine.hasOption('H')) {
        printUsage();
        return false;
      }

In the above code passing argument is handled by GnuParser class, there parse exception we are getting, in catch block any error we are getting, showing usage again.

catch (ParseException e) {
      System.err.println(e.getMessage());
      printUsage();
      return false;
    }
    return true;
  }

Better will throw parse Exception only.
Instead of printing usage again.
Based on Exception end user will come to know.
This has been fixed in 0.14 release. Please open new jira if you see any issues.

item.title: [HIVE-6710] Deadlocks seen in transaction handler using mysql
item.description: When multiple clients attempt to obtain locks a deadlock on the mysql database occasionally occurs.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
The issue is two fold:

  1. The code is not disciplined about ordering the access to the TXNS and HIVE_LOCKS tables, this needs to be fixed
  2. Per the mysql documentation , even when tables are accessed in the right order deadlocks can be seen due to row locking issues and thus the application should always be ready to re-start the transaction. This is observed in the TxnManager.lock function when two clients are obtaining locks at the same time.
Harish Butani This needs to be included in Hive 0.13
Ran tests locally, all looks good.
Alan Gates Can you create RB entry for this ?
Review board entry created, https://reviews.apache.org/r/19735/
It should be noted that this looks like I rewrote large sections of the code, but I did not. Each public method was wrapped in a try/catch block to handle deadlocks and retry.

item.title: [HIVE-6711] ORC maps uses getMapSize() from MapOI which is unreliable
item.description:
HIVE-6707 had issues with map size. getMapSize() of LazyMap and LazyBinaryMap does not deserialize the keys and count the number of unique keys. Since getMapSize() may return non-distinct count of keys, the length of maps stored using ORC's map tree writer will not be in sync with actual map size. As a result of this RLE reader will try to read beyond the disk range expecting more map entries and will throw exception.

Stack trace will look like:

Caused by: java.io.EOFException: Read past end of RLE integer from compressed stream Stream for column 2 kind DATA position: 22059699 length: 22059699 range: 0 offset: 22359014 limit: 22359014 range 0 = 0 to 22059699 uncompressed: 53370 to 53370
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.orc.RunLengthIntegerReaderV2.readValues(RunLengthIntegerReaderV2.java:54)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.orc.RunLengthIntegerReaderV2.next(RunLengthIntegerReaderV2.java:301)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.orc.RecordReaderImpl$StringDictionaryTreeReader.next(RecordReaderImpl.java:1572)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.orc.RecordReaderImpl$StringTreeReader.next(RecordReaderImpl.java:1330)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.orc.RecordReaderImpl$MapTreeReader.next(RecordReaderImpl.java:2041)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.orc.RecordReaderImpl$StructTreeReader.next(RecordReaderImpl.java:1772)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.orc.RecordReaderImpl.next(RecordReaderImpl.java:2963)
        at org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.orc.OrcInputFormat$OrcRecordReader.next(OrcInputFormat.java:121)
item.summary: ORC maps uses getMapSize() from MapOI which is unreliable

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

item.title: [HIVE-6712] HS2 JDBC driver is inconsistent w.r.t. auto commit
item.description:
I see an inconsistency in HS2 JDBC driver code:

  @Override
  public void setAutoCommit(boolean autoCommit) throws SQLException {
    if (autoCommit) {
      throw new SQLException("enabling autocommit is not supported");
    }
  }

From above, it seems that auto commit is not supported. However, 

  @Override
  public boolean getAutoCommit() throws SQLException {
    return true;
  }
item.summary: HS2 JDBC driver is inconsistent w.r.t. auto commit

item.title: [HIVE-6713] Add HiveServer2 regression tests to track performance over time
item.description:
From the experience of HIVE-3746, it makes good sense to find a way to quantify and track HiveServer2's performance.

Note that the focus here is not on query performance which is being actively addressed by a broad range of activities (Stinger etc). Rather, the scope is focused solely on the behavior and performance of Hive's Thrift IDL definition and Thrift's implementation of this.

There are at least two important entry points to Hive over Thrift: ODBC and JDBC.
item.environment: Across ODBC client env: Windows, Linux, OS X
item.summary: Add HiveServer2 regression tests to track performance over time

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-6714] Fix getMapSize() of LazyMap
item.description:
HIVE-6707 fixed an issue with lazy maps. Lazy maps scans for keys using key separators and maintains a counter for the number of keys i.e; map size. However keys may include duplicates in which returning the number of keys for map size will be wrong as after deserialization the actual map will not have duplicate keys.

This is a subtask of HIVE-6707 to fix the getMapSize() api.
item.summary: Fix getMapSize() of LazyMap

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: This patch is generate on top of HIVE-6707

I think a cleaner way would be to eliminate duplicate keys during parse stage. The deserialized structs would only have each key once. That way you don't have to carry both actual (deduped) and original size. Is that possible?
This patch addressed Gunther Hagleitner's review comments. The parse() method now eliminates the duplicate keys (duplicate key/value offsets are not stored).
+1 LGTM
Reuploading again for jenkins.

item.title: [HIVE-6717] We deserialize the entire configuration during vertex initialization
item.description: During the custom vertex initialization, we are deserializing the entire configuration. This can be very expensive. The right way to do it would be to have a serialized subset of the configuration that is used during initialization.
item.summary: We deserialize the entire configuration during vertex initialization

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-6718] Splits grouping is optional
item.description: In hive-tez, we are always grouping splits in case of bucket map joins. This can be made optional. This affects utilization of the cluster as it affects parallelism. In some cases, it could be better to turn off grouping for increased parallelism as well. Making it optional gives better control to the administrator.
item.summary: Splits grouping is optional

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-6719] No results from getTables() and getColumns with null tableNamePattern
item.description:
Calling DatabaseMetaData.getTables() or getColumns() with a null tableNamePattern argument returns 0 results, counter to the JDBC spec.

For example, the following will return no results:

meta.getTables( null, schema, null , tableTypes);
item.summary: No results from getTables() and getColumns with null tableNamePattern

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
For getColumns, the issue is with the columnNamePattern. Specifying "%" in both methods produces the expected results, but specifying null returns a result set with 0 records. The specification says that if null is used, the parameter will not be used in the search (which should be the equivalent of "%"), which is what most other JDBC drivers do.

Squirrel does not show the catalog and I assume it is due to this.
Seems to be an Impala bug, and not actually a JDBC bug. This is now being tracked here: https://issues.cloudera.org/browse/IMPALA-925

item.title: [HIVE-6720] Implement getURL()
item.description: DatabaseMetaData.getURL() throws an unsupported exception. This should be modified to return a valid value.
item.summary: Implement getURL()

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Note that the API docs call for returning a null if URL cannot be returned, and an exception only on DB error.
I want to watch the received error message from hive.

Just found this issue while troubleshooting Netbeans support for the Hive2 JDBC. Raising his an exception instead of returning null breaks Netbeans so that you can't even run simple select statements.

item.title: [HIVE-6721] Streaming ingest needs to be able to send many heartbeats together
item.description: The heartbeat method added to HiveMetaStoreClient is intended for SQL operations where the user will have one transaction and a hand full of locks. But in the streaming ingest case the client opens a batch of transactions together. In this case we need a way for the client to send a heartbeat for this batch of transactions rather than being forced to send the heartbeats one at a time.
item.summary: Streaming ingest needs to be able to send many heartbeats together

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Harish Butani This should go into 0.13 as well, as HIVE-5687 will depend on it.

This patch adds a call to allow a range of heartbeats to be sent together. This way the streaming client can send a range for all open transactions. If a transaction is aborted or missing that is in the range it is reported back to the caller, but the valid transactions still have a heartbeat recorded. The caller must determine if it is acceptable for those transactions to be missing or aborted.

Review board posted: https://reviews.apache.org/r/19812/

item.title: [HIVE-6724] HCatStorer throws ClassCastException while storing tinyint/smallint data
item.description:
given Hive tables:
1) create table pig_hcatalog_1 (si smallint) STORED AS TEXTFILE;
2) create table all100k (si smallint, ti tinyint) STORED ....;

the following sequence of steps (assuming there is data in all100k)

a=load 'all100k' using org.apache.hive.hcatalog.pig.HCatLoader();
b = foreach a generate si;
store b into 'pig_hcatalog_1' using org.apache.hive.hcatalog.pig.HCatStorer();

produces

item.summary: HCatStorer throws ClassCastException while storing tinyint/smallint data

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
The use case is Hive-Pig-Hive.
HCatLoader automatically sets hcat.data.tiny.small.int.promotion=true as that is required by Pig. HCatStorer did the opposite for no good reason. Since Pig doesn't evaluate each statement separately, the Storer action clobbered Loader action (the context that contains the configuration is shared). I changed Storer not to do that.

item.title: [HIVE-6725] getTables() only returns partial table descriptions
item.description:
The ResultSet from calling DatabaseMetaData.getTables() only returns 5 columns, as opposed to the 10 columns called for in the JDBC spec:

TABLE_CAT String => table catalog (may be null)
TABLE_SCHEM String => table schema (may be null)
TABLE_NAME String => table name
TABLE_TYPE String => table type. Typical types are "TABLE", "VIEW", "SYSTEM TABLE", "GLOBAL TEMPORARY", "LOCAL TEMPORARY", "ALIAS", "SYNONYM".
REMARKS String => explanatory comment on the table
TYPE_CAT String => the types catalog (may be null)
TYPE_SCHEM String => the types schema (may be null)
TYPE_NAME String => type name (may be null)
SELF_REFERENCING_COL_NAME String => name of the designated "identifier" column of a typed table (may be null)
REF_GENERATION String => specifies how values in SELF_REFERENCING_COL_NAME are created. Values are "SYSTEM", "USER", "DERIVED". (may be null)
item.summary: getTables() only returns partial table descriptions

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-6726] Hcat cli does not close SessionState
item.description:
When running HCat E2E tests, it was observed that hcat cli left Tez sessions on the RM which ultimately die upon timeout. Expected behavior is to clean the Tez sessions immediately upon exit. This is causing slowness in system tests as over time lot of orphan Tez sessions hang around.

On looking through code, it seems obvious in retrospect because HCatCli starts a SessionState, but does not explicitly call close on them, exiting the jvm through System.exit instead. This needs to be changed to explicitly call SessionState.close() before exiting.
item.summary: Hcat cli does not close SessionState

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

item.title: [HIVE-6727] Table level stats for external tables are set incorrectly
item.description:
if you do the following:

CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE anaylyze_external (a INT) LOCATION 'data/files/ext_test';
describe formatted anaylyze_external;

The table level stats are:

Table Parameters:
	COLUMN_STATS_ACCURATE	true
	EXTERNAL            	TRUE
	numFiles            	0
	numRows             	6
	rawDataSize         	6
	totalSize           	0

numFiles and totalSize is always 0.
Issue is:
MetaStoreUtils:updateUnpartitionedTableStatsFast attempts to set table level stats from FileStatus. But it doesn't account for External tables, it always calls Warehouse.getFileStatusesForUnpartitionedTable
item.summary: Table level stats for external tables are set incorrectly

item.title: [HIVE-6734] DDL locking too course grained in new db txn manager
item.description: All DDL operations currently acquire an exclusive lock. This is too course grained, as some operations like alter table add partition shouldn't get an exclusive lock on the entire table.
item.summary: DDL locking too course grained in new db txn manager

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Harish Butani This needs to be in 0.13 as well.
Ran tests locally, all looks good.
Alan Gates Can you create RB entry for it ?

I changed the grain of locking for DDL statements. In the initial checkin I had set all DDL statements to exclusive lock. But this results in a whole table being locked so that a partition can be added. This is excessive. So I went back and added a DDL_EXCLUSIVE, DDL_SHARED, and DDL_NO_LOCK so that different DDL statements could obtain appropriate grains of locks. For example, add partition is now a shared lock, drop partition is an exclusive lock, and add function is no lock.
Created review board https://reviews.apache.org/r/19736/
Left some comments on RB.
New patch that addresses Ashutosh's comments.

Committed to 0.13 & trunk.

I use DummyTxnManager as the default value of hive.txn.manager. I noticed that the CREATE TEMPORARY FUNCTION requires a EXCLUSIVE lock while it's writetype is DLL_NO_LOCK in the DummyTxnManager. Maybe it's a good idea to check the DLL's writetype in DummyTxnManager too.

item.title: [HIVE-6735] Make scalable dynamic partitioning work in vectorized mode
item.description: HIVE-6455 added support for scalable dynamic partitioning. This is subtask to make HIVE-6455 work with vectorized operators.
item.summary: Make scalable dynamic partitioning work in vectorized mode

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Only VectorReduceSink needs changes to make it work in vectorized mode. Changes are similar to HIVE-6455. Added qfile test for MR and Tez for vectorized mode.
Testing this on a scale=200 data-load.
+1 LGTM
Addressed Gopal V's comments.
Reuploading for jenkins

item.title: [HIVE-6736] We can do order independent bucket trait propagation
item.description:
From HIVE-6447

1. You can have the case where
parentOfParent bucketCols is a,b
and parent bucketCols is b,a
i.e. bucketing trait doesn't depend on order.

2. You can also have the case
parentOfParent trait is (a)
and join is on (a,b) You can avoid shuffle in this case.
item.summary: We can do order independent bucket trait propagation

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-6737] We can do order independent bucket trait propagation
item.description:

1. You can have the case where
parentOfParent bucketCols is a,b
and parent bucketCols is b,a
i.e. bucketing trait doesn't depend on order.

2. You can also have the case
parentOfParent trait is (a)
and join is on (a,b) You can avoid shuffle in this case.
item.summary: We can do order independent bucket trait propagation

item.title: [HIVE-6738] HiveServer2 secure Thrift/HTTP needs to accept doAs parameter from proxying intermediary
item.description:
See already implemented JIra
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-5155
Support secure proxy user access to HiveServer2

That fix expects the hive.server2.proxy.user parameter to come in Thrift body.

When an intermediary gateway like Apache Knox is authenticating the end client and then proxying the request to HiveServer2, it is not practical for the intermediary like Apache Knox to modify thrift content.

Intermediary like Apache Knox should be able to assert doAs in a query parameter. This paradigm is already established by other Hadoop ecosystem components like WebHDFS, WebHCat, Oozie and HBase and Hive needs to be aligned with them.

The doAs asserted in query parameter should override if doAs specified in Thrift body.
item.summary: HiveServer2 secure Thrift/HTTP needs to accept doAs parameter from proxying intermediary

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: short description of requirement, some implementation details and verification of the enhancement

Patch implementing the enhancement.
This has to go in after the patch for HIVE-6697 that is pending in queue is merged.
description revised based on review input from [~vaibhavgumashta]

Comments on the patch-

  • I think it is better to log at debug level instead of info for these messages, as it is logged for every request.
  • If the proxy user is already set in SessionManager through the url, I think we can skip the check in sessionconf.

Thanks Thejas for the review.
Would revise code to accommodate for both comments.
Then, attach a new patch.
revised patch based on review comments from Thejas M Nair
Dilli Arumugam I left some minor comments on review board. Other than those, +1 (non-binding) from my side.

Thejas M Nair I think this is good to commit. I have a patch for HIVE-6837 which will need to be applied on top of this.

Harish Butani Another bug for 13. This has been +1ed, waiting to get committed.

Thanks!

Verified that tests pass with the patch.
Patch committed to trunk and 0.13 branch.
Thanks for the contribution Dilli, and for the review Vaibhav!

item.title: [HIVE-6739] Hive HBase query fails on Tez due to missing jars and then due to NPE in getSplits
item.description: Tez paths in Hive never call configure on the input/output operators, so (among other things, potentially) requisite files never get added to the job
item.summary: Hive HBase query fails on Tez due to missing jars and then due to NPE in getSplits

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: preliminary patch. Need to set up cluster to test this (and later remove logging), haven't done so far
Nm, it iterates work graph incorrectly on review now.
Will attach updated patch today which fixes the issue and also another one with NPE in getSplits

patch that provides files to AM and vertices, and also makes sure correct configs are set to avoid NPE.
The part for AM may change in response to better Tez APIs...

Updated patch. Note that this depends on a feature in yet-unreleased Tez 0.4; if that ships first I will update pom, otherwise it will be split into two patches. We will commit restart-AM path here, and relocalize path separately in Hive 0.14

item.title: [HIVE-6740] Typo in src/ql/pom.xml
item.description:
Line 502 of http://svn.apache.org/viewvc/hive/trunk/ql/pom.xml?view=markup

I think it should say "avro-mapred", not "arvro-mapred":

<include>org.apache.avro:arvro-mapred</include>

This causes hive-exec not to have avro-mapred stuff, and thus you will get errors querying avro tables such as:

Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.apache.avro.mapred.FsInput

NO PRECOMMIT TESTS
item.summary: Typo in src/ql/pom.xml

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Good catch, seems to affect 0.13 as well. Did you want to submit a fix, or let others take a look ?
Nah, I don't have a fix, I figured someone could just correct this at their convenience

Thanks Grisha for the analysis, attaching the fix.

Built + verified that org.apache.avro.mapred classes including FsInput is in the hive-exec uber-jar.
Skip precommit tests, verify by building normally.

+1

Does this sound bad enough to be included in 0.13?
Thanks Xuefu, yea it would be good to include in 0.13 if possible, its looks very similar to the typo you fixed about the parquet dependency and would have similar affect.
Committed to trunk and 0.13

item.title: [HIVE-6741] HiveServer2 startup fails in secure (kerberos) mode due to backward incompatible hadoop change
item.description:
HADOOP-10211 made a backward incompatible change due to which the following hive call returns a null map (HiveAuthFactory-old):

Map<String, String> hadoopSaslProps =  ShimLoader.getHadoopThriftAuthBridge().
        getHadoopSaslProperties(conf); 
SaslQOP hadoopSaslQOP = SaslQOP.fromString(hadoopSaslProps.get(Sasl.QOP));
if(hadoopSaslQOP.ordinal() > saslQOP.ordinal()) {
LOG.warn(MessageFormat.format("\"hadoop.rpc.protection\" is set to higher security level " +
          "{0} then {1} which is set to {2}", hadoopSaslQOP.toString(),
          ConfVars.HIVE_SERVER2_THRIFT_SASL_QOP.varname, saslQOP.toString()));
}

Since this code path is only used for logging hadoop sasl qop values in case hadoop's qop > hive's qop, we can do away with this and add a general log message.
item.summary: HiveServer2 startup fails in secure (kerberos) mode due to backward incompatible hadoop change

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Marking this as blocker for 13. Will submit a patch in few mins.

cc Harish Butani: This should be a blocker for 13. Trivial patch to fix it.
Thejas M Nair Prasad Mujumdar: Patch is up for review.

[~vaibhavgumashta] Thanks for looking into the problem.
HADOOP-10211 seems to be fixed in Hadoop 2.4 and trunk (3.0), which are both unreleased hadoop versions.
Hive is still using last hadoop release 2.3.0. Shouldn't this wait till we upgrade hadoop dependencies ?

Prasad Mujumdar Sure, we can wait. However, the problem will manifest whenever we upgrade so I thought fixing it sooner is no harm. But since 13 won't be using hadoop 2.4, let me tag this for 14.

Thejas M Nair Had chat with hadoop folks, and it seems they won't revert the change. Check the logic for the change in this comment: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HADOOP-10221?focusedCommentId=13923205&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13923205.

[~vaibhavgumashta] This is an incompatible change and hence would be better to do this along with the hadoop upgrade. The code being removed is applicable to Hadoop 2.3. We might not switch to Hadoop 2.4 at all for Hive 0.14 as well, or may be Hadoop 2.4 will change the logic later during it's release cycle etc. In such cases the patch won't be adding any value.
Also https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-6657 is proposing to add miniKdc based test in Hive. I guess that would catch this problem once we upgrade, so won't miss out this patch.

Regarding the actual patch, is the new unconditional log message needed at all ? It's getting printed be printed regardless the hadoop.rpc.protection and hive.server2.thrift.sasl.qop config. Would it make sense to just add it to docs and remove the message ?

Prasad Mujumdar Makes sense.

I also think we can get away with the log message and document it instead. Let me post a new patch.

Incorporated Prasad Mujumdar's feedback.

cc Jason Dere
I think it looks good - can you also add a comment to HadoopThriftAuthBridge20S.getHadoopSaslProperties() saying that method no longer works with Hadoop 2.4.0?
Jason Dere Done. Also added a note in hive-default. Since this call is used in metastore client/server, I'll create a new jira for that. Thanks!

item.title: [HIVE-6748] FileSinkOperator needs to cleanup held references for container reuse
item.description:
The current implementation of FileSinkOperator runs into trouble when reusing the same query pipeline aggressively with container reuse.

This is due to a prevFSP writer which is left referenced after closeOp() and which is not reset even for initializeOp().
